intro: Chaetanthera salsoloides, commonly known as desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has a robust root system that helps it survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, which reduce water loss. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its dispersal in harsh environments.
